question_text: What does the HTML5 doctype declaration specify?
options: The character encoding of the document
The document type and HTML version
The CSS version to be used
explanation: The doctype declaration <!DOCTYPE html> specifies that the document is an HTML5 document, which helps browsers render the page correctly.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is used to define navigation links?
explanation: The <nav> element in HTML5 is specifically designed to contain navigation links for the website or application.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <header> element in HTML5?
options: To display the website header image
To define a container for introductory content
To define the main heading of the page
explanation: The <header> element represents a container for introductory content or navigational links, typically containing headings, logos, or search forms.

question_text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the text color of an element.

question_text: What does the CSS box model consist of?
explanation: The CSS box model consists of content, padding, border, and margin, which determine the space an element occupies.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is best suited for marking up a single piece of content that can stand alone?
explanation: The <article> element represents a self-contained composition that could be distributed and reused independently.

question_text: Which CSS property is used to create space around elements?
explanation: The 'margin' property creates space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <main> element in HTML5?
options: To define the main content area
explanation: The <main> element specifies the main content of a document, and there should only be one <main> element per page.

question_text: Which CSS property controls the transparency of an element?
explanation: The 'opacity' property sets the transparency level of an element, with values from 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque).

question_text: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
explanation: <div> is a block-level element that takes up the full width available, while <span> is an inline element that only takes up as much width as necessary.

question_text: Which HTML5 element is used for self-contained content?
explanation: The <section> element represents a standalone section of content, typically with a heading.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <aside> element?
explanation: The <aside> element represents content that is tangentially related to the content around it, like sidebars.

question_text: Which CSS property controls text alignment?
explanation: The text-align property sets the horizontal alignment of inline-level or table-cell boxes.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <footer> element?
explanation: The <footer> element represents the footer of a document or section, typically containing copyright or contact information.

question_text: Which CSS property creates rounded corners?
explanation: The border-radius property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <figure> element?
explanation: The <figure> element represents self-contained content, optionally with a caption, like images or diagrams.

question_text: Which CSS property controls element positioning?
explanation: The position property specifies how an element is positioned in a document: static, relative, absolute, fixed, or sticky.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <figcaption> element?
explanation: The <figcaption> element represents a caption or legend for a <figure> element.

question_text: Which CSS property creates shadows?
explanation: The box-shadow property adds shadow effects around an element's frame.

question_text: What is the purpose of CSS Grid?
explanation: CSS Grid is a two-dimensional layout system for creating complex responsive layouts with rows and columns.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <details> element?
explanation: The <details> element creates a disclosure widget in which information is only visible when the widget is toggled into an open state.

question_text: What is the purpose of CSS Flexbox?
explanation: CSS Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout method for arranging items in rows or columns.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <time> element?
explanation: The <time> element represents a specific period in time, which can be machine-readable.

question_text: What is the purpose of CSS transitions?
explanation: CSS transitions allow property changes to occur smoothly over a specified duration.

question_text: Which HTML5 element defines navigation links?
explanation: The <nav> element represents a section of a page that links to other pages or parts within the page.

question_text: Which CSS property controls element display?
explanation: The display property specifies how an element is displayed: block, inline, inline-block, flex, grid, or none.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <mark> element?
explanation: The <mark> element represents text that should be highlighted or marked for reference purposes.

question_text: Which CSS property controls z-index stacking?
explanation: The z-index property specifies the stack order of positioned elements along the z-axis.

question_text: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag?
explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as charset, description, and keywords.

question_text: What is the purpose of CSS media queries?
explanation: CSS media queries apply different styles based on device characteristics like screen size, orientation, or resolution.
